args: What are you doing out in the courtyard\nat this hour, Ieyasu?
I was merely examining the night sky.
The stars above must be the same as the\nones we see in Hinomoto, no?
How is it that such different countries\ncan exist beneath the selfsame sky?
I wanted to thank you for earlier.
You found a way to save everyone\nwithout catching the Empire's eye.
You also spoke to that lord of honor.\nCan you tell me a little more about\nhonor in Hinomoto?
I've been wondering if it's some\nspecial way of thinking.
Honor is the most important virtue\non the path of the warrior.
What is the path of the warrior?
They are the rules that govern all in\na warrior's life.

We are tasked to carry out justice bravely
and correctly. In order to do so, there
must be a code that we can follow.
A correct way to live, if you will.
Swords and dragons have the power to\ncause great harm, and the common\npeople rightfully fear them.
Justice obtained through fear is no justice\nat all—which is why it must be tempered\nalways with honor.
So that's why you think the greatest victory\nis one gained without bloodshed...
Indeed. I cannot abide the sight of blood.\nIt...frightens me.
Spilled blood means that someone has\nbeen injured. This is the antithesis of\nthe peace I've fought for all my life.
The best war is the one that never occurs.
I'm really surprised to hear this.
It just doesn't sound like something you'd\nhear from a man who made a pact with\nthe dragon of battle.
She does indeed—and we are not\ncompatible in this at all.
I knew it...\nYet you still managed to form a soulpact?
It wasn't easy... She refused to give me so\nmuch as the time of day at first.
Marishiten loves battle, but I hate it.\nIn fact, I so loathe it that it nearly led to\nmy destruction on several occasions.
Then why did you choose Marishiten\nfor your soulpact?
Because I am greedy; I lusted after\nthe power necessary to keep the peace.
More than anything, I wanted that peace\nto continue into eternity.
I could never fulfill such an unreasonable\nwish on my own.
And so, I sought out the most powerful\nand bloodthirsty dragon that I knew of.
...I don't get you at all. You hate war,\nbut you're so damn GOOD at it!
If you hate fightin' so much, throw your\nweapons away and just stay home!
But then I could not protect\nthe people's peace.
You wanna use my power for PEACE?\nBwa ha ha! You ARE a strange one!
Everybody who's approached me up to this\npoint has been some power-hungry\ntyrant lookin' to rule the world.
Ruling the world is incidental to me.\nI seek your power only to save it.
So the world's just...what? A side-dish?\nBwaaa ha ha!
But sure, okay. I'll take a spin on this\nwhimsical ride of yours.
So that's why she made a soulpact\nwith you...
She's a wonderful partner now, but in\nthe beginning she was merely bemused.
In truth, I cannot blame her for this.
She'd probably feel exactly the same way\nabout what I'm trying to do here.
But I'm still not going to give up.
If I just keep moving forward,\nI'll eventually accomplish things\nthat once seemed impossible.
You, too, are a strange one—\nand yet there is power to your words.
They almost make me feel as though\nmy goals can become reality.
Your goals will be achieved because\nYOU make it so. They won't just happen.
You just need to be confident and keep\nfollowing your warrior's path.
Then as one who shares your desire\nfor peace, I swear this to you...
I will continue to follow the way of the\nwarrior until I see my peace realized!
And I won't stop until my people know\nthe same peace that Hinomoto does.
It is good to have met an honest royal\nlike you in a strange and foreign land.
And yet, we still have\nmuch to accomplish...
